comments:
eclipse-SDK-I20060526-0010-win32

The package explorer has a context menu Refactor->Move which allows a plugin or feature project to be moved but if you select an existing folder the operation is only half completed and an error is reported.

At a minimum the the finish button in the dialog should not be disabled if the move is not going to work.

To reproduce:

1. File->New->Plugin Development/Plugin Project. Accept all defaults.
2. In the wizard enter project1 as the name of the project and hit finish.
3. In the project explorer right click on the plugin project, Refactor->Move...
4. In the move project dialog uncheck "Use default location"
5. Hit Browse..., Create a new folder anywhere on your hard drive and select that new folder.
6. Hit OK

Expected result, the project is moved.

Actual Result, a dialog reports an error as follows:

Problems encountered while moving resources.
  Could not move: /project1.
    File already exists on disk: E:\temp\AAA.

What is worse is that the project has been partially moved, the package 
explorer shows the project with a red X, and an internal error shows in the log with this trace.

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: File not found: E:\temp\AAA\.project.
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.filesystem.Policy.error(Policy.java:60)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.filesystem.local.LocalFile.openInputStream(LocalFile.java:327)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.read(FileSystemResourceManager.java:609)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.File.getContents(File.java:290)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.descriptionChanged(FileSystemResourceManager.java:235)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.internalWrite(FileSystemResourceManager.java:454)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.writeDescription(Project.java:1093)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.writeDescription(Project.java:1074)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceTree.movedProjectSubtree(ResourceTree.java:666)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceTree.standardMoveProject(ResourceTree.java:1043)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.move(Project.java:794)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.MoveProjectAction$1.execute(MoveProjectAction.java:103)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation$1.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1737)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:113)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[271]: java.io.FileNotFoundException: E:\temp\ABXS\.project (The system cannot find the file specified)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.filesystem.local.LocalFile.openInputStream(LocalFile.java:318)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.read(FileSystemResourceManager.java:609)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.File.getContents(File.java:290)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.descriptionChanged(FileSystemResourceManager.java:235)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.internalWrite(FileSystemResourceManager.java:454)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.writeDescription(Project.java:1093)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.writeDescription(Project.java:1074)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceTree.movedProjectSubtree(ResourceTree.java:666)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceTree.standardMoveProject(ResourceTree.java:1043)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.move(Project.java:794)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.MoveProjectAction$1.execute(MoveProjectAction.java:103)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation$1.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1737)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:113)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)
Let's move to JDT first, as it seems to allow you to do an illegal move of resources.

Hmm, the errors in the log in this case are misleading. Those errors don't actually have any impact on the result of the move - they probably shouldn't be logged.

The actual error is the one presented in the dialog: Could not move project... file already exists on disk.  This is consistent with other move operations that fail when the destination of the resource already exists.  However, this doesn't fail in 3.1, so I have to dig a bit deeper to see what the difference is.  If move is not allowed in this case it should have been trapped at the UI prior to starting.

traces.message: E:\temp\ABXS\.project (The system cannot find the file specified)
